column5: Tyson Foods Inc said on Monday it would sell its Mexican and Brazilian poultry businesses to JBS SA's Pilgrim's Pride for $575 million and use the proceeds to pay down debt from its pending $7.7 billion purchase of Hillshire Brands Co.

column4: UPDATE 3-Tyson to sell Mexico  Brazil poultry businesses to JBS
column5: July 28 Tyson Foods Inc said on Monday it would sell its Mexican and Brazilian poultry businesses to JBS SA's Pilgrim's Pride for $575 million and use the proceeds to pay down debt from its pending $7.7 billion purchase of Hillshire Brands Co.

column4: Shares of Brazil's JBS rise after deal to buy Tyson units
column5: SAO PAULO  July 28 Shares of JBS SA  the world's largest meat producer  rose 3 percent in Sao Paulo trading on Monday after it announced it would buy Tyson Foods Inc's Mexican and Brazilian poultry businesses for $575 million.

column4: Tyson to sell Mexican and Brazilian poultry businesses
column5: July 28 Tyson Foods Inc  the biggest U.S. meat processor  said it would sell its Mexican and Brazilian poultry businesses to Pilgrims Pride Corp  parent JBS SA for $575 million.

column4: Shares  dollar steady ahead of key U.S. data  Fed meeting
column5: NEW YORK World stock markets were little changed on Monday while the U.S. dollar traded mostly flat against a basket of major currencies ahead of key U.S. economic reports and events this week.

column4: JD.com to sell Microsoft's Xbox One games console in China
column5: BEIJING JD.com Inc  China's second-biggest e-commerce company by market share  will accept pre-orders for Microsoft Corp's Xbox One games console in China from July 28 to July 30  the firm said on Monday.
